required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Study to Measure the Effect of OP-101 After Being Administered Subcutaneous in Healthy Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Open-Label Single-Ascending Dose Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of OP-101 (Dendrimer N-acetyl-cysteine) After Subcutaneous Administration in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: A clinical study to measure the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of OP-101 After Subcutaneous Administration in Healthy Volunteers

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAEs) and Serious Adverse Events
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) was defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation participant administered a pharmaceutical product, which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. A TEAE (treatment-emergent adverse event) was defined as an AE that emerges, having been absent prior to the study, or an AE that worsens in severity after the first dose of the study drug. Serious AE (SAE) was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes: death; life-threatening adverse event, required hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization; persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly/birth defect, or a medically important event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of OP-101
Pharmacokinetics: Time to Reach Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of OP-101
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, 0.5 hours and at 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, 12, 16, 24, 30-36, 48 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Tmax: time to reach maximum observed plasma concentration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time Zero to the Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUC0-last) of OP-101
secondary_outcome.description: AUC0-last: Area under the concentration versus time curve from time zero to the last quantifiable concentration (Clast).

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time Zero to 48 Hour Post Dose Time Point (AUC0-48) of OP-101
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the concentration versus time curve from time zero to 48 hour post dose time point.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, 0 to 4, 4 to 8, 8 to 12, 12 to 18, 18 to 24, and 24 to 48 hours post dose
secondary_outcome.description: CLR was defined as renal clearance of the drug from plasma utilizing the AUC and cumulative amount of unchanged study drug excreted into the urine (Ae) to the same duration (as Amount recovered/AUC at 0-48 hours).

arm_group.description: Subjects in Cohort 1 will be administered 4 mg/kg OP-101 as a subcutaneous (SC) injection.
Subjects in Cohort 2 will be administered 8 mg/kg OP-101 as a SC injection.

intervention.description: Subcutaneous injection of OP-101 in healthy volunteers

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 8 participants were enrolled and treated in the study.

group.title: Cohort 1: 4 mg/kg
group.description: Participants in Cohort 1 received a single dose of 4 milligram per kg (mg/kg) OP-101 as subcutaneous (SC) injection on Day 1.

group.title: Cohort 2: 8 mg/kg
group.description: Participants in Cohort 2 received a single dose of 8 mg/kg OP-101 as SC injection on Day 1.

baseline.population: Analysis was performed on safety population which included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug.

group.description: Participants in Cohort 1 received a single dose of 4 milligram per kg (mg/kg) OP-101 as subcutaneous (SC) injection on Day 1.

group.title: Cohort 2: 8 mg/kg
group.description: Participants in Cohort 2 received a single dose of 8 mg/kg OP-101 as SC injection on Day 1.

A TEAE (treatment-emergent adverse event) was defined as an AE that emerges, having been absent prior to the study, or an AE that worsens in severity after the first dose of the study drug. Serious AE (SAE) was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes: death; life-threatening adverse event, required hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization; persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly/birth defect, or a medically important event.

A TEAE (treatment-emergent adverse event) was defined as an AE that emerges, having been absent prior to the study, or an AE that worsens in severity after the first dose of the study drug. Serious AE (SAE) was an AE resulting in any of the following outcomes: death; life-threatening adverse event, required hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization; persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly/birth defect, or a medically important event.

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetics: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of OP-101
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on pharmacokinetic (PK) parameter population which was defined as all participants who received a dose of study drug and had at least 1 PK parameter.

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetics: Renal Clearance (CLR) for OP-101
outcome.description: CLR was defined as renal clearance of the drug from plasma utilizing the AUC and cumulative amount of unchanged study drug excreted into the urine (Ae) to the same duration (as Amount recovered/AUC at 0-48 hours).
outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose, 0 to 4, 4 to 8, 8 to 12, 12 to 18, 18 to 24, and 24 to 48 hours post dose
outcome.population: Analysis was performed on PK parameter population. Here, 'overall number of participants analyzed' = participants evaluable for this outcome measure.

measure.description: CLR was defined as renal clearance of the drug from plasma utilizing the AUC and cumulative amount of unchanged study drug excreted into the urine (Ae) to the same duration (as Amount recovered/AUC at 0-48 hours).
measure.population: Analysis was performed on PK parameter population. Here, 'overall number of participants analyzed' = participants evaluable for this outcome measure.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There IS an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Jeffrey L Cleland, PhD, Executive Chair
